Structs/ContinuousSortFunction.html#/s:v.name: interObjectDelay
Structs/ContinuousSortFunction.html#/s:v.abstract: A SortFunction that has variable interObjectDelay values. Unlike other SortFunction implementations, for the ContinuousSortFunction you specify a duration and the SortFunction will compute the necessary interObjectDelay values for each of the subviews. This means that the offset times will not be multiples of the delay like usual.

Structs/ContinuousSortFunction.html#/s:v.name: position
Structs/ContinuousSortFunction.html#/s:v.abstract: A SortFunction that has variable interObjectDelay values. Unlike other SortFunction implementations, for the ContinuousSortFunction you specify a duration and the SortFunction will compute the necessary interObjectDelay values for each of the subviews. This means that the offset times will not be multiples of the delay like usual.

Structs/ContinuousSortFunction.html#/s:v.name: reversed
Structs/ContinuousSortFunction.html#/s:v.abstract: A SortFunction that has variable interObjectDelay values. Unlike other SortFunction implementations, for the ContinuousSortFunction you specify a duration and the SortFunction will compute the necessary interObjectDelay values for each of the subviews. This means that the offset times will not be multiples of the delay like usual.

Structs/ContinuousSortFunction.html#/s:F.name: timeOffsets(view:recursiveDepth:)
Structs/ContinuousSortFunction.html#/s:F.abstract: A SortFunction that has variable interObjectDelay values. Unlike other SortFunction implementations, for the ContinuousSortFunction you specify a duration and the SortFunction will compute the necessary interObjectDelay values for each of the subviews. This means that the offset times will not be multiples of the delay like usual.

Structs/StandardAnimation.html#/s:vP6Spr.name: changeFunction
Structs/StandardAnimation.html#/s:vP6Spr.abstract: A wrapper around the standard UIViewAnimation block with options publicly accessible. See, UIViewAnimation for more

Structs/StandardAnimation.html#/s:FP6Spr.name: animate(delay:view:completion:)
Structs/StandardAnimation.html#/s:FP6Spr.abstract: A wrapper around the standard UIViewAnimation block with options publicly accessible. See, UIViewAnimation for more

Structs/ContinuousWeightedSortFunction.h.name: interObjectDelay
Structs/ContinuousWeightedSortFunction.h.abstract: A SortFunction that has variable interObjectDelay values using weights to structure when views should animate. Unlike other SortFunction implementations, for the ContinuousWeightedSortFunction you specify a duration and the SortFunction will compute the necessary interObjectDelay values for each of the subviews. This means that the offset times will not be multiples of the delay like usual. The lighter the weight the faster the views will animate.

Structs/ContinuousWeightedSortFunction.h.name: position
Structs/ContinuousWeightedSortFunction.h.abstract: A SortFunction that has variable interObjectDelay values using weights to structure when views should animate. Unlike other SortFunction implementations, for the ContinuousWeightedSortFunction you specify a duration and the SortFunction will compute the necessary interObjectDelay values for each of the subviews. This means that the offset times will not be multiples of the delay like usual. The lighter the weight the faster the views will animate.

Structs/ContinuousWeightedSortFunction.h.name: reversed
Structs/ContinuousWeightedSortFunction.h.abstract: A SortFunction that has variable interObjectDelay values using weights to structure when views should animate. Unlike other SortFunction implementations, for the ContinuousWeightedSortFunction you specify a duration and the SortFunction will compute the necessary interObjectDelay values for each of the subviews. This means that the offset times will not be multiples of the delay like usual. The lighter the weight the faster the views will animate.

Structs/ContinuousWeightedSortFunction.h.name: horizontalWeight
Structs/ContinuousWeightedSortFunction.h.abstract: A SortFunction that has variable interObjectDelay values using weights to structure when views should animate. Unlike other SortFunction implementations, for the ContinuousWeightedSortFunction you specify a duration and the SortFunction will compute the necessary interObjectDelay values for each of the subviews. This means that the offset times will not be multiples of the delay like usual. The lighter the weight the faster the views will animate.

Structs/ContinuousWeightedSortFunction.h.name: verticalWeight
Structs/ContinuousWeightedSortFunction.h.abstract: A SortFunction that has variable interObjectDelay values using weights to structure when views should animate. Unlike other SortFunction implementations, for the ContinuousWeightedSortFunction you specify a duration and the SortFunction will compute the necessary interObjectDelay values for each of the subviews. This means that the offset times will not be multiples of the delay like usual. The lighter the weight the faster the views will animate.

Structs/ContinuousWeightedSortFunction.h.name: timeOffsets(view:recursiveDepth:)
Structs/ContinuousWeightedSortFunction.h.abstract: A SortFunction that has variable interObjectDelay values using weights to structure when views should animate. Unlike other SortFunction implementations, for the ContinuousWeightedSortFunction you specify a duration and the SortFunction will compute the necessary interObjectDelay values for each of the subviews. This means that the offset times will not be multiples of the delay like usual. The lighter the weight the faster the views will animate.

Structs/InlineSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.name: interObjectDelay
Structs/InlineSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.abstract: A SortFunction that animates the views in as if they were reading text from left to right (based on the corner that you set).

Structs/InlineSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.name: reversed
Structs/InlineSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.abstract: A SortFunction that animates the views in as if they were reading text from left to right (based on the corner that you set).

Structs/InlineSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.name: corner
Structs/InlineSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.abstract: A SortFunction that animates the views in as if they were reading text from left to right (based on the corner that you set).

Structs/InlineSortFunction.html#/s:FP6Sp.name: timeOffsets(view:recursiveDepth:)
Structs/InlineSortFunction.html#/s:FP6Sp.abstract: A SortFunction that animates the views in as if they were reading text from left to right (based on the corner that you set).

Structs/LinearSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.name: direction
Structs/LinearSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.abstract: A Linear wiping SortFunction. This will consider the rows or columns of the views rather than looking at their exact coordinates. Views that have the same vertical or horizontal components, based on the direction, will animate in at the same time.

Structs/LinearSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.name: interObjectDelay
Structs/LinearSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.abstract: A Linear wiping SortFunction. This will consider the rows or columns of the views rather than looking at their exact coordinates. Views that have the same vertical or horizontal components, based on the direction, will animate in at the same time.

Structs/LinearSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.name: reversed
Structs/LinearSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.abstract: A Linear wiping SortFunction. This will consider the rows or columns of the views rather than looking at their exact coordinates. Views that have the same vertical or horizontal components, based on the direction, will animate in at the same time.

Structs/LinearSortFunction.html#/s:FP6Sp.name: distanceBetween(_:and:)
Structs/LinearSortFunction.html#/s:FP6Sp.abstract: A Linear wiping SortFunction. This will consider the rows or columns of the views rather than looking at their exact coordinates. Views that have the same vertical or horizontal components, based on the direction, will animate in at the same time.

Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce7.name: prepare(withRecursiveDepth:changeFunction:)
Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce7.abstract: Use this method to setup all of your views before the animation occurs. This could include hiding, fading, translating them, etc…

Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce7.name: animate(withSortFunction:prepare:animation:exclude:recursiveDepth:completion:)
Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce7.abstract: Run a spruce style animation on this view. This is a customized method that allows you to take more control over how the animation progresses.

Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce7.name: animate(_:duration:completion:)
Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce7.abstract: Run a spruce style animation on this view. This method is the most basic form of a spruce animation and allows you to setup your view with stock spruce animations. Feel free to chain together animations that would work nicely together.

Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce7.name: animate(_:sortFunction:duration:completion:)
Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce7.abstract: Run a spruce style animation on this view. This allows you to setup your view with stock spruce animations. Feel free to chain together animations that would work nicely together.

Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce7.name: animate(_:duration:animationType:completion:)
Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce7.abstract: Run a spruce style animation on this view. This method allows you to setup your view with stock spruce animations. Feel free to chain together animations that would work nicely together.

Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce7.name: animate(_:duration:animationType:sortFunction:prepare:completion:)
Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce7.abstract: Run a spruce style animation on this view. This method allows you to setup your view with stock spruce animations. Feel free to chain together animations that would work nicely together.

Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce7.name: prepare(with:recursiveDepth:)
Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce7.abstract: Use this method to setup all of your views before the animation occurs. This could include hiding, fading, translating them, etc…

Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce1.name: hideAllSubviews(recursiveDepth:)
Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce1.abstract: Quick method to hide all of the subviews of a view. Use this if you want to make sure that none of the views that will be animated will be shown on screen before you transition them.

Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce8.name: subviews(withRecursiveDepth:)
Structs/Spruce.html#/s:FV6Spruce6Spruce8.abstract: The receiver’s immediate subviews given the recursive depth. If a subview contains other subviews, they will be listed in the array following their parent view. Consider the following example:

Structs/RadialSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.name: position
Structs/RadialSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.abstract: A SortFunction that will offset the views in a circular fashion. This means that rather than looking flat like the CorneredSortFunction, there will be a curve going out of the position as if the views were in an expanding circle.

Structs/RadialSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.name: interObjectDelay
Structs/RadialSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.abstract: A SortFunction that will offset the views in a circular fashion. This means that rather than looking flat like the CorneredSortFunction, there will be a curve going out of the position as if the views were in an expanding circle.

Structs/RadialSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.name: reversed
Structs/RadialSortFunction.html#/s:vP6Sp.abstract: A SortFunction that will offset the views in a circular fashion. This means that rather than looking flat like the CorneredSortFunction, there will be a curve going out of the position as if the views were in an expanding circle.

Structs/SpringAnimation.html#/s:vP6Spruc.name: changeFunction
Structs/SpringAnimation.html#/s:vP6Spruc.abstract: A wrapper around the spring UIViewAnimation block with options publicly accessible. See, UIViewAnimation for more

Structs/SpringAnimation.html#/s:vV6Spruc.name: animationOptions
Structs/SpringAnimation.html#/s:vV6Spruc.abstract: A mask of options indicating how you want to perform the animations

Structs/SpringAnimation.html#/s:FP6Spruc.name: animate(delay:view:completion:)
Structs/SpringAnimation.html#/s:FP6Spruc.abstract: A mask of options indicating how you want to perform the animations

Structs/SprucePoint.html#/s:FV6Spruce11S.name: euclideanDistance(to:)
Structs/SprucePoint.html#/s:FV6Spruce11S.abstract: Calculate the euclidean distance between two points

Structs/SprucePoint.html#/s:FV6Spruce11S.name: horizontalDistance(to:)
Structs/SprucePoint.html#/s:FV6Spruce11S.abstract: Calculate the horizontal euclidean distance between two points. Esentially the same thing as euclideanDistance except it ignores the y components of the two points.

Structs/SprucePoint.html#/s:FV6Spruce11S.name: verticalDistance(to:)
Structs/SprucePoint.html#/s:FV6Spruce11S.abstract: Calculate the vertical euclidean distance between two points. Esentially the same thing as euclideanDistance except it ignores the x components of the two points.

Structs/RandomSortFunction.html#/s:FP6Sp.name: timeOffsets(view:recursiveDepth:)
Structs/RandomSortFunction.html#/s:FP6Sp.abstract: A SortFunction that will animate all the views in with a random delay. No 2 views will animate in with the same offset. The views will be placed in an array, shuffled, and then each view will be asigned an offset given the interObjectDelay.

Structs/DefaultSortFunction.html#/s:FP6S.name: timeOffsets(view:recursiveDepth:)
Structs/DefaultSortFunction.html#/s:FP6S.abstract: The basic SortFunction. Use this sort function if you want to animate in all views at the same time and give an interObjectDelay of 0.0. Note that this SortFunction will animate the views based on the order they were added to the animation view. This means that the way the views are sorted in the subviews array is the way that they will be sorted by this SortFunction.

Structs/CorneredSortFunction.html#/s:vP6.name: corner
Structs/CorneredSortFunction.html#/s:vP6.abstract: A SortFunction designed to animate in a corner like fashion. The views near the starting corner will animate first. In essence it appears to be a wiping function that will continue diagonally based on that corner.

Structs/CorneredSortFunction.html#/s:vP6.name: interObjectDelay
Structs/CorneredSortFunction.html#/s:vP6.abstract: A SortFunction designed to animate in a corner like fashion. The views near the starting corner will animate first. In essence it appears to be a wiping function that will continue diagonally based on that corner.

Structs/CorneredSortFunction.html#/s:vP6.name: reversed
Structs/CorneredSortFunction.html#/s:vP6.abstract: A SortFunction designed to animate in a corner like fashion. The views near the starting corner will animate first. In essence it appears to be a wiping function that will continue diagonally based on that corner.

Structs/CorneredSortFunction.html#/s:FP6.name: timeOffsets(view:recursiveDepth:)
Structs/CorneredSortFunction.html#/s:FP6.abstract: A SortFunction designed to animate in a corner like fashion. The views near the starting corner will animate first. In essence it appears to be a wiping function that will continue diagonally based on that corner.

Structs/CorneredSortFunction.html#/s:FP6.name: distancePoint(view:subviews:)
Structs/CorneredSortFunction.html#/s:FP6.abstract: A SortFunction designed to animate in a corner like fashion. The views near the starting corner will animate first. In essence it appears to be a wiping function that will continue diagonally based on that corner.

Structs/CorneredSortFunction.html.name: CorneredSortFunction
Structs/CorneredSortFunction.html.abstract: A SortFunction designed to animate in a corner like fashion. The views near the starting corner will animate first. In essence it appears to be a wiping function that will continue diagonally based on that corner.

Structs/DefaultSortFunction.html.name: DefaultSortFunction
Structs/DefaultSortFunction.html.abstract: The basic SortFunction. Use this sort function if you want to animate in all views at the same time and give an interObjectDelay of 0.0. Note that this SortFunction will animate the views based on the order they were added to the animation view. This means that the way the views are sorted in the subviews array is the way that they will be sorted by this SortFunction.

Structs/RandomSortFunction.html.name: RandomSortFunction
Structs/RandomSortFunction.html.abstract: A SortFunction that will animate all the views in with a random delay. No 2 views will animate in with the same offset. The views will be placed in an array, shuffled, and then each view will be asigned an offset given the interObjectDelay.

Structs/SprucePoint.html.name: SprucePoint
Structs/SprucePoint.html.abstract: Internal struct to access CGPoint extensions. Use this to call methods such as .euclideanDistance

Structs.html#/s:V6Spruce9TimedView.name: TimedView
Structs.html#/s:V6Spruce9TimedView.abstract: An internal struct that is used to relate a view with a time offset. This is used to determine when each view is set to animate.

Structs/SpringAnimation.html.name: SpringAnimation
Structs/SpringAnimation.html.abstract: A wrapper around the spring UIViewAnimation block with options publicly accessible. See, UIViewAnimation for more

Structs/RadialSortFunction.html.name: RadialSortFunction
Structs/RadialSortFunction.html.abstract: A SortFunction that will offset the views in a circular fashion. This means that rather than looking flat like the CorneredSortFunction, there will be a curve going out of the position as if the views were in an expanding circle.

Structs/Spruce.html.name: Spruce
Structs/Spruce.html.abstract: Access to all of the Spruce library animations. Use this to call functions such as .animate or .prepare

Structs/LinearSortFunction.html.name: LinearSortFunction
Structs/LinearSortFunction.html.abstract: A Linear wiping SortFunction. This will consider the rows or columns of the views rather than looking at their exact coordinates. Views that have the same vertical or horizontal components, based on the direction, will animate in at the same time.

Structs/InlineSortFunction.html.name: InlineSortFunction
Structs/InlineSortFunction.html.abstract: A SortFunction that animates the views in as if they were reading text from left to right (based on the corner that you set).

Structs/ContinuousWeightedSortFunction.h.name: ContinuousWeightedSortFunction
Structs/ContinuousWeightedSortFunction.h.abstract: A SortFunction that has variable interObjectDelay values using weights to structure when views should animate. Unlike other SortFunction implementations, for the ContinuousWeightedSortFunction you specify a duration and the SortFunction will compute the necessary interObjectDelay values for each of the subviews. This means that the offset times will not be multiples of the delay like usual. The lighter the weight the faster the views will animate.

Structs/StandardAnimation.html.name: StandardAnimation
Structs/StandardAnimation.html.abstract: A wrapper around the standard UIViewAnimation block with options publicly accessible. See, UIViewAnimation for more

Structs/ContinuousSortFunction.html.name: ContinuousSortFunction
Structs/ContinuousSortFunction.html.abstract: A SortFunction that has variable interObjectDelay values. Unlike other SortFunction implementations, for the ContinuousSortFunction you specify a duration and the SortFunction will compute the necessary interObjectDelay values for each of the subviews. This means that the offset times will not be multiples of the delay like usual.

Protocols/CornerSortFunction.html#/s:vP6.name: corner
Protocols/CornerSortFunction.html#/s:vP6.abstract: The starting corner for the animation. Views will animate vertically and horizontally from this corner.

Protocols/CornerSortFunction.html#/s:FP6.name: distancePoint(view:subviews:)
Protocols/CornerSortFunction.html#/s:FP6.abstract: The starting corner for the animation. Views will animate vertically and horizontally from this corner.

Protocols/WeightSortFunction.html#/s:vP6.name: horizontalWeight
Protocols/WeightSortFunction.html#/s:vP6.abstract: the horizontal weight that should be applied to each of the distances between views

Protocols/WeightSortFunction.html#/s:vP6.name: verticalWeight
Protocols/WeightSortFunction.html#/s:vP6.abstract: the vertical weight that should be applied to each of the distances between views

Protocols/SpruceAnimation.html#/s:vP6Spr.name: changeFunction
Protocols/SpruceAnimation.html#/s:vP6Spr.abstract: Given a view, this closure will define the manipulations that will happen to that view

Protocols/SortFunction.html#/s:FP6Spruce.name: timeOffsets(view:)
Protocols/SortFunction.html#/s:FP6Spruce.abstract: Given a view, view sort the subviews in a way that matches the desired specification of the SortFunction. In an example case, if you wanted a radial sort function then this method would return an array of the subviews such that their time offets would be smaller near the center of the view and grow as they get further from the center point.

Protocols/SortFunction.html#/s:FP6Spruce.name: timeOffsets(view:recursiveDepth:)
Protocols/SortFunction.html#/s:FP6Spruce.abstract: Given a view, view sort the subviews in a way that matches the desired specification of the SortFunction. In an example case, if you wanted a radial sort function then this method would return an array of the subviews such that their time offets would be smaller near the center of the view and grow as they get further from the center point.

Protocols/DistanceSortFunction.html#/s:v.name: interObjectDelay
Protocols/DistanceSortFunction.html#/s:v.abstract: the time interval of delay between each of the objects on the screen when animating

Protocols/DistanceSortFunction.html#/s:v.name: reversed
Protocols/DistanceSortFunction.html#/s:v.abstract: a bool value as to whether the animation should proceeed forwards or backwards

Protocols/DistanceSortFunction.html#/s:F.name: distanceBetween(_:and:)
Protocols/DistanceSortFunction.html#/s:F.abstract: Compute the distance between two points. This can be any distance metric as long as you keep it consistent. For the default implementation, euclideanDistance is used.

Protocols/DistanceSortFunction.html#/s:F.name: distancePoint(view:subviews:)
Protocols/DistanceSortFunction.html#/s:F.abstract: With a DistanceSortFunction there has to be some main point that all the views are compared to. Since we understand that this point changes based on some value, you need to implement this method that will return a point for the given SortFunction configuration. The timeOffsets method will use this to grab a comparison point. From there the further the distance from the point the longer the delay for that view to start animating.

Protocols/DistanceSortFunction.html#/s:F.name: translate(distancePoint:intoSubviews:)
Protocols/DistanceSortFunction.html#/s:F.abstract: Given a point, find the closest subview to that point and then return the reference point of that subview. This way there will be at least one distance calculation that will have a zero value. We want to make sure that the animation will start right when called, thus there needs to be one view with a zero distance.

Protocols/DistanceSortFunction.html#/s:F.name: timeOffsets(view:recursiveDepth:)
Protocols/DistanceSortFunction.html#/s:F.abstract: Given a view, view sort the subviews in a way that matches the desired specification of the SortFunction. In an example case, if you wanted a radial sort function then this method would return an array of the subviews such that their time offets would be smaller near the center of the view and grow as they get further from the center point.

Protocols/DirectionSortFunction.html#/s:.name: direction
Protocols/DirectionSortFunction.html#/s:.abstract: the direction that the animation should follow

Protocols/DirectionSortFunction.html#/s:.name: distancePoint(view:subviews:)
Protocols/DirectionSortFunction.html#/s:.abstract: the direction that the animation should follow

Protocols/DirectionSortFunction.html.name: DirectionSortFunction
Protocols/DirectionSortFunction.html.abstract: A DistanceSortFunction that defines it’s distancePoint based on a Direction. Any distance based sort functions that use a direction variable in order to determine the setup of the animation should implement this protocol.

Protocols/DistanceSortFunction.html.name: DistanceSortFunction
Protocols/DistanceSortFunction.html.abstract: A SortFunction implementation that contain basic methods needed for doing distance comparisons. If you are implementing a SortFunction that considers distance to be one of it’s weighting mechanisms for sorting the views on the screen, then implementing this protocol would provide improvements over the standard SortFunction.

Protocols/SortFunction.html.name: SortFunction
Protocols/SortFunction.html.abstract: For all the views on the screen, we need to find some way of organizing them so that when we start the animation, each view will know when to start their individual animation. The concept of a SortFunction is just that. Given a view, the subviews of that view are sorted in a way that when animated they resemble the nature of that sort function. There are many different types of sort functions because there are so many ways to sort the subviews that are on the screen. If you don’t see a stock one that fits your need, feel free to implement this protocol and use your own custom SortFunction with Spruce.

Protocols/View.html.name: View
Protocols/View.html.abstract: Used to keep track of the UIView object and a changing reference point. Since Spruce allows for

Protocols/SpruceAnimation.html.name: SpruceAnimation
Protocols/SpruceAnimation.html.abstract: An animation type that handles how the views will change. Most of these are simply wrappers around the standard UIViewAnimation methods. This gives Spruce the flexibility to work with any style of animating.

Protocols/PositionSortFunction.html.name: PositionSortFunction
Protocols/PositionSortFunction.html.abstract: A DistanceSortFunction that uses a position attribute to define an animation’s starting point.

Protocols/WeightSortFunction.html.name: WeightSortFunction
Protocols/WeightSortFunction.html.abstract: A SortFunction that takes into account the vertical and horizontal weight of the position of views. The lighter the weight the the faster those views will start to animate. For example, if you had a light verticalWeight and a heavy horizontalWeight, the views that are vertically aligned with the starting position will animate before those that are horizontally aligned. This allows you to define the exact rigidness of a radial like SortFunction.

Protocols/CornerSortFunction.html.name: CornerSortFunction
Protocols/CornerSortFunction.html.abstract: A DistanceSortFunction that uses a corner attribute to define an animation’s starting point.

Extensions/UIView.html#/s:vE6SpruceCSo6U.name: spruce
Extensions/UIView.html#/s:vE6SpruceCSo6U.abstract: Access to all of the Spruce library animations. Use this to call functions such as .animate or .prepare

Extensions/CGPoint.html#/s:vE6SpruceVSC7.name: spruce
Extensions/CGPoint.html#/s:vE6SpruceVSC7.abstract: Access point extensions from Spruce. Call methods such as .euclideanDistance.

Enums/StockAnimation.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.name: slide
Enums/StockAnimation.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.abstract: Have your view slide to where it currently is. Provide a SlideDirection and Size to determine what the animation should look like.

Enums/StockAnimation.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.name: spin
Enums/StockAnimation.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.abstract: Spin the view in the direction of the size. Provide a Size to define how much the view should spin

Enums/StockAnimation.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.name: expand
Enums/StockAnimation.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.abstract: Have the view grow in size. Provide a Size to define by which scale the view should grow

Enums/StockAnimation.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.name: contract
Enums/StockAnimation.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.abstract: Have the view shrink in size. Provide a Size to define by which scale the view should shrink

Enums/StockAnimation.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.name: custom
Enums/StockAnimation.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.abstract: Provide custom prepare and change functions for the view to animate

Enums/Angle.html#/s:FO6Spruce5Angle10mod.name: moderately
Enums/Angle.html#/s:FO6Spruce5Angle10mod.abstract: the object should move a moderate amount

Enums/Angle.html#/s:FO6Spruce5Angle7toAn.name: toAngle
Enums/Angle.html#/s:FO6Spruce5Angle7toAn.abstract: provide your own value that you feel the object should move. The value you should provide should be a Double

Enums/SlideDirection.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.name: up
Enums/SlideDirection.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.abstract: start the view below its current position, and then slide upwards to where it currently is

Enums/SlideDirection.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.name: down
Enums/SlideDirection.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.abstract: start the view above its current position, and then slide downwards to where it currently is

Enums/SlideDirection.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.name: left
Enums/SlideDirection.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.abstract: start the view to the right of its current position, and then slide left to where it currently is

Enums/SlideDirection.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.name: right
Enums/SlideDirection.html#/s:FO6Spruce14.abstract: start the view to the left of its current position, and then slide right to where it currently is

Enums/SlideDirection.html.name: SlideDirection
Enums/SlideDirection.html.abstract: Direction that a slide animation should use.

Enums/Angle.html.name: Angle
Enums/Angle.html.abstract: How much the angle of an animation should change. This value changes based off of which type of StockAnimation is used.

Enums/Scale.html.name: Scale
Enums/Scale.html.abstract: How much the scale of an animation should change. This value changes based off of which type of StockAnimation is used.

Enums/Distance.html.name: Distance
Enums/Distance.html.abstract: How much the distance of a view animation should change. This value changes based off of which type of StockAnimation is used.

Enums/StockAnimation.html.name: StockAnimation
Enums/StockAnimation.html.abstract: A few stock animations that you can use with Spruce. We want to make it really easy for you to include animations so we tried to include the basics. Use these stock animations to slide, fade, spin, expand, or contract your views.

Enums/Position.html.name: Position
Enums/Position.html.abstract: A position on the screen. Use this to define specific locations on the screen where the animation should start

Enums/SpruceCorner.html.name: SpruceCorner
Enums/SpruceCorner.html.abstract: A representation of the corners of the view

Classes/SpruceViewController.html#/s:vC6.name: animations
Classes/SpruceViewController.html#/s:vC6.abstract: an array of spruce stock animations that will be used to animate all of the subviews of the animationView

Classes/SpruceViewController.html#/s:vC6.name: duration
Classes/SpruceViewController.html#/s:vC6.abstract: the length of each of the individual subview animations

Classes/SpruceViewController.html#/s:vC6.name: animationType
Classes/SpruceViewController.html#/s:vC6.abstract: the style of animation that will be apllied to each of the subviews

Classes/SpruceViewController.html#/s:vC6.name: sortFunction
Classes/SpruceViewController.html#/s:vC6.abstract: the sort function that should be used for choreographing the animations

Classes/SpruceViewController.html#/s:vC6.name: animationView
Classes/SpruceViewController.html#/s:vC6.abstract: the view that Spruce should be called on. This means that the subviews of this view will animate in.

Classes/SpruceViewController.html#/s:FC6.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/SpruceViewController.html#/s:FC6.abstract: in the viewDidLoad method all of the views are prepared for animation

Classes/SpruceViewController.html#/s:FC6.name: viewDidAppear(_:)
Classes/SpruceViewController.html#/s:FC6.abstract: a simple overrided method that will call spruce_up on the animationView. If the animationView is not set then nothing will happen. The code should silently fail.

Classes/SpruceButton.html#/s:vC6Spruce12.name: animation
Classes/SpruceButton.html#/s:vC6Spruce12.abstract: the stock animation that should be applied to the button upon press

Classes/SpruceButton.html#/s:vC6Spruce12.name: animationType
Classes/SpruceButton.html#/s:vC6Spruce12.abstract: the style of animation that should be used when animating the button
